statements.name: PROC ERUPSERT
statements.description: The ERUPSERT procedure updates existing documents and entities in a compound store or adds them to the compound store if they do not already exist. It also enables you to delete documents from the compound store.

arguments.name: COMMITMETHOD=
arguments.description: specifies how to update the compound store tables. You can specify the following values:

arguments.name: APPEND
arguments.description: appends changes to the existing compound store tables. This method is fast, but obsolete data remain in the compound store.

arguments.name: COPY
arguments.description: replaces the compound store tables and discards obsolete data.

arguments.name: DOCUMENTID=
arguments.description: specifies the variable (in the document tables) that stores the document ID.

arguments.name: OUTEXCLUDEDCOMPOUNDS=
arguments.description: specifies the output table for the excluded compounds. The table shows the compound values that have been excluded and their reason for being excluded.

arguments.name: PAGECACHELIMIT=
arguments.description: specifies the maximum size of the page cache.

arguments.name: RECORDID=
arguments.description: specifies the variable that stores the record ID.

arguments.name: VERSION=
arguments.description: specifies the variable in the document tables that stores the version number. The version number is used when documents are updated.

statements.name: COMPOUNDSTORE
statements.description: The COMPOUNDSTORE statement enables you to specify the tables to use for the compound store.

arguments.name: COMPOUNDTABLE=
arguments.description: specifies the name of the table in which to store compounds.

arguments.name: DOCUMENTTABLE=
arguments.description: specifies the name of the table in which to store documents.

arguments.name: ENTITYTABLE=
arguments.description: specifies the name of the table in which to store entities.

arguments.name: LOCKTABLE=
arguments.description: specifies the name of the table to use for preventing access to the compound store by other sessions while a procedure is running.

arguments.name: METADATATABLE=
arguments.description: specifies the name of the table in which to store the metadata, including the element, compound, and entity definitions.

statements.name: DELETEDOCUMENT
statements.description: The DELETEDOCUMENT statement enables you to specify documents whose data you want to delete from the compound store. You can specify the documents to delete individually by using an identifier and a type, or you can specify a table that contains a list of documents to delete.

arguments.name: METHOD=
arguments.description: specifies whether to delete documents that are listed in a table or via a document type and ID pair.

arguments.name: ID=
arguments.description: specifies the ID of the document when METHOD=DOCUMENT.

arguments.name: TYPE=
arguments.description: specifies the type of the document when METHOD=DOCUMENT.

arguments.name: VERSION=
arguments.description: specifies the highest version number of the document to delete when METHOD=DOCUMENT.

arguments.name: NAME=
arguments.description: specifies the name of the table that contains the documents to delete when METHOD=TABLE.

statements.name: DOCUMENT
statements.description: The DOCUMENT statement enables you to specify documents to add to the compound store. You must specify a type for the documents and a table that contains the documents to add to the compound store.

arguments.name: TABLE=
arguments.description: specifies the name of the input table that contains the documents. This table can include multiple documents, and each document can consist of one or more records.

arguments.name: TYPE=
arguments.description: specifies the type of the documents in the input table. All documents in the same document table must have the same type.

statements.name: OUTPUT
statements.description: The OUTPUT statement enables you to specify the table to use for output and other output options.

arguments.name: OUT=
arguments.description: specifies the output table in which to store results of the procedure.

arguments.name: OUTCOMPOUNDVALUE
arguments.description: includes in the output table the compound_value column, which contains a concatenation of the element values that make up the compound value.
